thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL FALL SPORTS ROUNDUP: GC girls win Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL FALL SPORTS ROUNDUP: GC girls win Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational

author: Herald Sports Staff
title: HIGH SCHOOL FALL SPORTS ROUNDUP: GC girls win Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational
text:
Contributed Tourney champs 
Grove City Lady Eagles won the 18th annual Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational title Wednesday at Buhl Farm courts, Hermitage. Wilmington was runner-up CORY BYKNISH | Herald 
West Middlesex's Kaeli Wikles passes the ball downfield as Mercer's Caitlyn Mattocks chases after. Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 8:01 am HIGH SCHOOL FALL SPORTS ROUNDUP: GC girls win Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational Herald Sports Staff The Herald HERMITAGE –– Led by singles titlists Emily Gordon and Katie Kosick and the doubles duos of Sydney Adams-Jenny Baglia and Sarah Munley-Logan Fuss, Grove City High girls garnered the championship of the 18th annual Buhl Farm Tennis Invitational. On Wednesday in Buhl Farm Park, Grove City (31) outdistanced Wilmington (26), Oil City (21), Greenville and Warren (15), Sharon (12), Kennedy Catholic (6) and Franklin for the team title. Tournament Director Sue McLaughlin reported 126 players competed in the day-long event. 1st Singles––Semifinals: Emily Gordon (GC) def. Carey Shaffer (S), 8-0; Cameron Leary (G) def. Taylor Cox (Wil), 8-3. Finals: Gordon def. Leary, 10-0. 2nd Singles––Semis: Allie Domer (OC) def. Hailey Mele (KC), 8-0; Maddy Gentile (G) def. Morgan McCommon (GC), 8-5. Finals: Domer def. Gentile, 10-1. 3rd Singles––Semis: Katie Kosick (GC) def. Jen Stevenson (OC), 8-4; Gracie Wood def. Emily Messina (S), 8-6. Finals: Kosick def. Wood, 10-6. 4th Singles––Semis: Abbie Buerkle (War) def. Katie Summers (KC), 8-3; Hannah Allison (Wil) Christine Kluck, 8-6. Finals: Buerkle def. Allison, 10-8. 1st Doubles– – Semis: Sydney Adams-Jenny Baglia (GC) def. Lydea Zoeller-Mackenzie Drotleff (Wil), 8-6; Olivia Klapec-Ally Stanley (OC) def. Mogan Lemmon-Rachel Cecco (War), 8-7(7-3). Finals: Adams-Baglia def. Klapec-Stanley, 10-9(7-3). 2nd Doubles––Semis: Marissa Litzenberg-Jen Peoples (Wil) def. Erin Hosick-Natalie Liscio (S), 8-4; Paige Fay-Grace O’Malley (G) def. Hannah Schettler-Sydney Callahan (OC), 8-7(7-4). Finals: Litzenberg-Peoples def. Fay-O’Malley, 10-5. 3rd Doubles––Semis: Sarah Munley-Logan Fuss (GC) def. Andrea Sterner-Cierra Gabryelski (S), 8-0; Maggie Milton-Grace Ferrell (Wil) def. Elle Moesta-Maddy Fleeger (Wil), 8-2. Finals: Munley-Fuss def. Milton-Ferrell, 8-7(7-5). GIRLS TENNIS • Fairview 3, Hickory 2 –– At Hermitage, the visiting Lady Tigers triumphed, as Shannon Sertz, Stephanie Ace and Julie Schwartz swept straight-sets singles matches. The tandems of Nikki Marrone-Anna Derloni and Sarah McGonigle-Kaylen Woods did likewise for Hickory (11-2, 11-0 Region 1). “It was great for our team to play 2014 Class AAA District 10 champion Fairview to give our players an opportunity to play a higher level of competition across all positions,” said Hickory co-coach Ed Newmeyer. “I’m so proud of our doubles teams for coming away with impressive wins in their matches.” Singles: Sertz (F) def. Morgan Bender, 6-0, 6-2; Ace (F) def. Lauren McGongle, 6-0, 6-2; Schwartz (F) def. Erin Hunter, 6-3, 6-2. Doubles: Marrone-Derloni (H) def. Alexa Klemm-SamanthaWilcko, 6-2, 6-2; S.McGonigle-Woods (H) def. Erica Jasinski-Brooke Daeschner, 6-3, 6-2. BOYS GOLF • Hickory 171, Mercer 193 — At Spring Valley Golf Course Monday, the Hornets improved to 15-2. Brandon Cioffi was medalist for Hickory with a 38, followed by teammates Colton Pellis 41, Dean Baker and Mason Liburdi 46s. Mark Peters had 40 to lead the Mustangs, while other totals were Matt Mathias and Andrew Brinker 50s, and Mason Borowicz 53. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL • Freeport 3, Hickory 0 –- At Hermitage, the Lady Hornets (2-3) were handed a 25-19, 25-9, 25-14 loss. Hickory: Leslie Gargano 19 assists; Katie Gustas 13 kills, 6 digs; Dani Krahe 6 kills, 8 digs. JV: Freeport, 25-12, 25-19. • Farrell 3, Reynolds 2 — At Transfer on Tuesday the Lady Steelers won the close match. Scores, Farrell stats were published in Wednesday’s Herald. Reynolds : Taylor Cadman 6 kills, 5 blocks; Tiffany Foltz 6 kills, 9 points; Macy Greenfield 7 digs; Rachael Harnett 12 assists, 10 points; Rachel Kilgore 9 points; Magan O’Hara 7 kills, 7 points. • Commodore Perry 3, Wilmington 1 — At Sheakleyville Monday, the host Lady Panthers’ scores, stats were published in Wednesday’s Herald. Wilmington: Amanda Lewis 9 kills, 7 digs; Julia Strobel 10 points, 15 assists, 10 digs; Jo Strobel 6 points, 18 digs; Madeline Whiting 6 kills, 8 digs; Sarah Schwenke 6 kills; Maggie Behm 8 digs; Lexi Brumbaugh 5 assists. • Lakeview 3, Mercer 0 — At Stoneboro Tuesday, the hosts won, 25-19, 25-16, 25-19. Mercer (1-2 region, 3-4): Bryanna Fedorchak 7 points, 6 kills; Kaitlyn Nemetz 7 digs; Miranda Wimer 10 points, 7 kills; Lindsay Nemeth 10 points, 7 assists; Morgan Addicott 5 assists; Hannah McElrath 8 points, 7 digs; Jordyn Buchanan 5 digs; Allie Cameron 13 points; Sami Metts 7 points. Lakeview : No stats submitted. JV: Lakeview, 25-13, 25-15. GIRLS SOCCER • Karns City 3, Wilmington 2 — KC scored with 7 seconds remaining to nip the Lady Hounds (5-2-1). Leanne Wynder and Evi Ciafre scored goals and had assists for Wilmington. JV: 2-2. BOYS SOCCER • Sharon 3, Hickory 2 — At Tiger Stadium Tuesday, Sharon struck first with goals by Braeden Hoover and Isaiah Zajac before Hickory’s Jacob Scarton rung a 35-yarder of the crossbar into the net. However, Sharon’s Hoover responded with a 3rd goal just before intermission that proved to be the winner. Scarton scored the lone goal of the 2nd period for the Hornets. Chris Hartnegal, Jacob Babcanec, and Hunter Kennedy assisted for the Tigers. Shaun McGowan had an assist for Hickory. Sharon netkeeper Mike Piccirilli made 10 saves, many late in the 2nd half. Hickory’s Brandon Beader had 16 saves. JV: Sharon, 4-1 • Grove City 8, Wilmington 2 — At Grove City’s Forker Field Tuesday, the hosts led at halftime 7-0 and coasted. Caleb Stewart led the way with 2 goals and 3 assists. Nate Zimmerman also scored 2 goals. Wyatt Grimm, Ryan Fagan, Will Kemeny and Ethan Barraza chipped in with a goal apiece. Tanner McKnight, Josh Woodman and Aleksandr Duran each added an assist. Noah Labbiento and Matt Pataki scored for Wilmington. Grove City outshot Wilmington, 25-6 (10-3 on goal). Shaun Flynn made 1 save for Grove City; Robbie Leck made 2 for Wilmington. GIRLS SOCCER • Hickory 4, Slippery Rock 1 –– At Slippery Rock, the visiting Lady Hornets harvested the road win. Lauren Bell and Jacquelyn Smith tallied twice apiece for Hickory. Bell, Emily Maurer and Brianna McGowan were credited with assists. Lilly Weitzel scored Slippery Rock’s lone goal. Taylor Mears made 8 saves for Hickory (2-0 region, 7-1-2 overall). JV: Hickory, 2-0.
